snippet: A block on the popular video Web site following the circulation of an anti-Islamic video has been met with praise, despite concerns of rights advocates.
abstract: Memo from Afghanistan; Afghan government has yet to restore access to YouTube more than two months after it banned access to Web site to prevent spread of anti-Islamic video; ban has been met with praise by many Afghans, despite complaints of censorship by Afghan rights advocates.
lead_paragraph: A block on the popular video Web site following the circulation of an anti-Islamic video has been met with praise, despite concerns of rights advocates.

headline.seo: YouTube Ban Is Shrugged Off in Afghanistan
headline.main: YouTube Ban, Spurred by Anti-Islamic Video, Is Met With Shrugs
headline.print_headline: YouTube Ban, Spurred by Anti-Islamic Video, Is Met With Shrugs
